Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp with an elongated oval body, a domed top, a flat base, and almost vertical walls. The filling-hole is at the rear, and the projecting wick-hole is surrounded by a flat oval rim. On top of the lamp is a male head, probably Harpokrates, with an elaborate hair arrangement, a protruding tongue, and exposed teeth. On top of the head is a rectangular base with three feathers on top, and behind these is a broken projection, probably a handle. At each side of the head is a wing-like projection. Decorated with a reddish slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q613)
